item.title: A Beginner's Git Glossary
item.description: A Beginner’s Git Glossary Simple explanations of Git things. Branch A collection of commits. Commit A snapshot of your repository. Contains extra information like when the snapshot was taken and a (hopefully) helpful message. Remote A server that talks Git, and maintains a version of your repository. Repository A directory on your computer that Git keeps track of.

item.title: Simple git: Getting started
item.description: Simple git: Getting started This is a collection of Git commands and short explanations of what they do. It should have you using the most common 80% of Git functionality chop chop. Phrases that are marked like this are commands that you can use in your terminal program. Basic local workflow If you follow these steps you should have a fully functional Git repository that tracks changes for you, and that you can use to collaborate on code (or documents, or files, or anything) with other people.
